lists.title: Eat Light Before Boarding
lists.sub_title: Have a light meal 1-2 hours before departure. Avoid heavy, greasy, or spicy foods

lists.title: Stay Hydrated
lists.sub_title: Drink plenty of water before and during the trip. Dehydration can worsen seasickness

lists.title: Avoid Strong Odors
lists.sub_title: Skip strong-smelling foods like fish or garlic before sailing - they can trigger nausea

lists.title: Limit Alcohol
lists.sub_title: Excessive alcohol consumption affects balance and can increase seasickness. Drink responsibly

lists.title: Ginger Helps
lists.sub_title: Ginger tea, ginger candy, or ginger tablets can help prevent and reduce seasickness naturally

lists.title: Fresh Air
lists.sub_title: If feeling queasy, stay on deck in fresh air and focus on the horizon. Avoid staying in enclosed spaces

lists.title: Stay Seated While Moving
lists.sub_title: Remain seated when the vessel is in motion, especially during acceleration or turns

lists.title: Hold Railings
lists.sub_title: Always use handrails when moving around the vessel, especially in rough waters

lists.title: Avoid Edges
lists.sub_title: Please don't stand at the edge of the vessel or lean over railings, especially with children

lists.title: Follow Crew Instructions
lists.sub_title: Our crew's instructions are for your safety - please follow them promptly and completely

lists.title: Supervise Children
lists.sub_title: Children under 12 must be supervised by an adult at all times. Life jackets are mandatory for kids

lists.title: No Diving or Swimming
lists.sub_title: Swimming is only permitted when the vessel is anchored and with crew supervision

lists.title: Sun Protection
lists.sub_title: Sunscreen (reef-safe preferred), sunglasses, and a hat - the sun reflects strongly off the water

lists.title: Motion Sickness Remedies
lists.sub_title: Bring seasickness medication if you're prone to motion sickness (take 30 minutes before departure)

lists.title: Personal Medications
lists.sub_title: Bring any personal medications you may need during the trip

lists.title: Waterproof Bag
lists.sub_title: A waterproof pouch or bag for electronics and valuables to protect from water spray

lists.title: Light Jacket
lists.sub_title: Even on warm days, it can get breezy on the water, especially during sunset cruises
